[ U ] the division of written or spoken words into syllables, or the combination of sounds or letters to form syllables: The program offers a suite of learning tools, including syllabification, pronunciation, phonetic spelling, and a dictionary. In some dictionaries, syllabication is used to show where a word can be hyphenated at the end of a line of text. One strategy involved syllabification across a word boundary.
